snippet: Critics say the European Union’s practice of funding policy groups that tend to be supportive rather than critical limits discussion and fuels disenchantment over the push for greater integration.
abstract: Critics claim that European Union’s practice of funding policy groups that are supportive of it rather than critical limits discussion of its role and leads to insular thinking that excludes views of many Europeans; hold that scheme fuels disenchantment over push for greater integration.
lead_paragraph: Critics say the European Union’s practice of funding policy groups that tend to be supportive rather than critical limits discussion and fuels disenchantment over the push for greater integration.

headline.main: Europeans Are Faulted Over Using Funds to Support Like-Minded Voices
headline.print_headline: Europeans Are Faulted Over Using Funds to Support Like-Minded Voices
